author: @AIMLBites
text: Updated code for creating window with quit button -   from tkinter import * class Window (Frame): Â Â Â  def __init__(self,master = None): Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  Frame.__init__(self,master) Â Â Â Â Â Â Â   Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  self.master = master  Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  self.init_window()  Â Â Â  def init_window(self): Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  self.master.title("GUI")  Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  self.pack(fill=BOTH, expand = 1)  Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  quitButton = Button(self, text = 'Quit')  Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  quitButton.place(x=0, y=0) Â Â Â Â Â Â Â   root = Tk()  width = 400 height = 300  widths = root.winfo_screenwidth() heights = root.winfo_screenheight()  widthx = (widths/2) - (width/2) heighty = (heights/2) - (height/2)  root.geometry('%dx%d+%d+%d' % (width, height, widthx, heighty))  app = Window(root)  root.mainloop()

author: @rabbittherabbit
text: basically i get tk as title and button is no show no click   import tkinter # "from tkinter import *" imports everything in tkinter from tkinter import *  # Make a window class class Window(Frame):     #passing through the frame of tkinter the window is     # Frame widget which may contain other widgets and can have a 3d border.     # def _iinit_(self, master = None, cnf = {}, **kw):     # constructs a fram widget with the parent MASTER.     # cnf = cnfmerge((cnf, kw))     def __init__(self, master = None):# could get away with just self         ''' valid resources names: background, bd, bg, borderwidth, class, colormap, container, cursor, height, highlightbackground, highlight color, highlightthickness, relief, takefocus, visual, width. '''         Frame.__init__(self, master)                  self.master = master # main window          def __init__window(self):          # initilasizing the window and making the title GUI         self.master.Title("GUI")          self.pack(fill=BOTH, expand=1) # adjust dimension as needed          quitbutton = Button(self, text="Quit", command=self.cilent_exit)          quitbutton.pack() # places quit button          #def cilent_exit(self):    root = Tk() root.geometry("400x300")  #importing Tk from tkinter  #def tk_strictMotif(self, boolean = None): '''#set Tcl internal variable, whethetr the look and feel should adhere to Motif A parameter of 1 means adhere to Motif (e.g. no color change if mouse passes over slider).''' #Returns the set value.      # Return self.tk.getboolean(self.tk.call('set', 'tk_struictMotif', boolean))  app = Window(master = root)  root.mainloop()# generates our window  #result actually sizable window
